meanings.sent1: Her sneb caught everyone's attention during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: He always has a clever sneb ready for any situation.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's sneb had the audience laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: His sneb was like a well-aimed arrow hitting its target.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's sneb left a lasting impression on the students.

meanings.definition: To speak in a sharp or witty manner.
meanings.sent1: She would sneb whenever she wanted to impress her friends.
meanings.sent2: He tends to sneb when he's feeling playful.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to sneb after hearing it from its owner.
meanings.sent4: The politician would sneb during debates to sway the audience.
meanings.sent5: The children giggled as they tried to sneb like the characters in the story.

meanings.definition: To make a sharp or witty comment.
meanings.sent1: He would always sneb about the weather when he had nothing else to say.
meanings.sent2: She tends to sneb about the latest gossip in town.
meanings.sent3: The siblings would sneb at each other's jokes to show their bond.
meanings.sent4: The writer would sneb in his articles to keep the readers engaged.
meanings.sent5: The friends would often sneb about their inside jokes to lighten the mood.
